definition: to try harder/to redouble one's efforts
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences

sentences.english: Therefore, we should make great efforts to consolidate and develop the party's ruling resources.
sentences.chinese: 因此，要加大力度巩吲和开发党的执政资源。

sentences.english: We must be forceful in our call for a halt to the marketing and use of monotherapies.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须加大力度呼吁，停止营销和使用单一药物。

sentences.english: The government should strengthen and standardize China's professional accreditation system of public relations practitioners.
sentences.chinese: 政府要加大力度，规范我国公关员职业认证体系。

sentences.english: Development of urban tourism in Hengyang has great potentialities and profound significance.
sentences.chinese: 衡阳市旅游发展潜力大，意义深远，应加大力度开发。

sentences.english: Intensify efforts to develop elderly university school-based physical education curriculum.
sentences.chinese: 加大力度开发老年大学校本体育课程。

sentences.english: Regulate the administrative region with more energy; expand the scale of small town.
sentences.chinese: 加大力度对行政区划进行调整，扩大小城镇规模。

definition: to put effort into sth/to try really hard
to intensify/to speed up/to step up
to strike a severe blow/to crack down/to take strong measures
to impel/to carry forward/to push on/to advance/to drive forward
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
